text: What can computer science tell us about what biological systems do and how they do it?  Can these chemical information-processing functions beduplicatedreplicatedimitatedwrittenreplicatedin digital computing systems? What are the effectconsequencesimplicationsfactorsimplicationsof developments in computer science in understanding the nature of causality? Aaron Sloman, author of Computer Revolution in Philosophyleadsmovesdelvesharnessesdelvesinto the world of connections between ideas developed in computer science, biology and philosophy, providing new fieldsconceptsideasinsightsinsightsinto some fundamental questions about the nature of consciousness and free will.
